snippet: The employment gains in July, which were fewer than expected, were not on track to absorb the backlog of unemployed workers anytime soon. The jobless rate ticked down to 7.4%.
abstract: Long and slow recovery of American economy stumbles as employers add disappointing 162,000 jobs, leaving uncertainty about timing of Federal Reserve's plans to begin tapering its extraordinary efforts to revive growth; jobless rate drops to 7.4 percent.

byline.contributor: Nelson D. Schwartz and Binyamin Appelbaum contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The employment gains in July, which were fewer than expected, were not on track to absorb the backlog of unemployed workers anytime soon. The jobless rate ticked down to 7.4%.

headline.main: U.S. Adds 162,000 Jobs as Growth Remains Sluggish
headline.print_headline: Job Growth Is Sluggish, But Rate Falls to 7.4%
